article:
{{Infobox writing system
| name = French Braille type = Alphabet typedesc = (non-linear) time = 1837
| languages = French fam1 = night writing fam2 = early braille children =
| English Braille German Braille Arabic Braille etc., etc. creator =
| Louis Braille unicode = [http://www.unicode.org/charts/PDF/U2800.pdf U+2800 to
| U+283F] iso15924 = sample = DSC 4050-MR-Braille.jpg note = none
}} 'French Braille' is the original braille alphabet, and the basis of all
others. The alphabetic order of French has become the basis of the international
braille convention, used by most braille alphabets around the world. However,
only the 25 basic letters of the French alphabet plus w have become
internationalized; the additional letters are largely restricted to French
Braille and the alphabets of some neighboring European countries.
